author: NewsBreak Original
text:
By Hayden Thompson ,
3 hours ago
HUNTINGDON COUNTY, Pa. (WTAJ) — The ALL IN Campus Democracy Challenge (ALL IN) announced that Juniata College made the “Most Engaged” list for 2024 student voting.
The ALL IN “ Most Engaged Campus for College Student Voting ” recognizes colleges and universities that have outstanding efforts to increase non-partisan student voter participation. Juniata has joined 471 other colleges on the list for completing all four actions required by ALL IN.
The following actions were required to make the list:
Participating in the ALL IN Campus Democracy Challenge Sharing 2022 NSLVE Reports with campus voting data with ALL IN Developing and submitting a 2024 democratic engagement action plan with ALL IN Having a current signatory to ALL IN’s Higher Education Presidents’ Commitment to Full Student Voter Participation Juniata’s ALL IN for Democracy team included Dennis Plane, Darah Worley, Bryce Garland, Charolette Ridge, Derek James, Shane Moran and Deb Roney. Team members came from the communication and politics departments, the Center for Community Engagement, the Office of Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, the Statton Learning Commons and representatives from the local chapter of the American Association of University Women.
Get the latest news, weather forecasts and sports stories delivered straight to your inbox! Sign up for our newsletters . The campus hosted a series of events and speakers that focused on voter registration, education and mobilization leading up to, on and after the 2024 presidential election. Some events included debate watch parties, voter registration drives, panel discussions, candidate forums, book displays and campus debates.
“The work of our campus ALL IN for Democracy team underscores the power of civil and civic discourse and reinforces the relevance and meaning of elections,” Juniata College Provost, Lauren Bowen, said. “Our team provided voter education and mobilized voter registration and participation. I am grateful to the coalition for their considerable and noteworthy efforts.”
The ALL IN Campus Democracy currently engages 10.8 million students from more than 1,075 institutions in all 50 states and the District of Columbia.
